project_abstract.cdata: The Lima Water Rehabilitation and Management Project aims at improving water supply and sanitation networks, including water wells, at promoting water conservation, at expanding services to the urban poor in Lima's low income areas, and, at strengthening Lima Water and Sewerage Company's - SEDAPAL - institutional capacity. The expansion of services under the additional finance will incorporate the experience of the project implementation to date, and that from international experiences in the design of water and sanitation projects for low income communities. This additional finance is justified due to a funding shortfall beyond the Borrower's control - bankruptcy of the financing agency for secondary networks - where only 60 percent of the project's original expansion targets for water and sanitation services have been achieved, thus risking to substantially under-utilize a significant proportion of the Bank resources already been devoted to the expansion of primary networks, due to the absence of secondary networks to connect with households of intended beneficiaries. Strong political commitment has already been demonstrated for project implementation, and likewise, SEDAPAL demonstrated its implementation capacity by reaching (and exceeding as well) those targeted project components directly under its control.
